newsitem.title: UK: Midland Ind. Newspapers in 3.7 mln stg buy.
newsitem.headline: Midland Ind. Newspapers in 3.7 mln stg buy.

text.p: Midland Independent News Plc said on Thursday it had purchased Echo Press Ltd for 3.7 million stg.
Echo Press publishes the weekly Loughborough Echo and six associated titles.
The acquisition, which includes a commercial printing operation, adds to the strength of the group's Midlands franchise, chairman Sir Norman Fowler said in a statement.
The Echo has a circulation of 21,000 which makes it one of the strongest paid-for weekly titles in the UK, Fowler told the the annual general meeting.

He said the group a "promising" first quarter on the trading front. "Good advertising revenue growth in most categories has been coupled with a significant fall in newsprint prices from those experienced in 1996".
